actions.committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.
Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 94-217.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #220 (377-17).
Referred to Senate Committee on Commerce.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Commerce, S. Rept. 94-271.

official_title: An Act to amend the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1972 to authorize appropriations to carry out the provisions of such Act for fiscal year 1976 and for the transition period following such fiscal year, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries with amendment, H. Rept. 94-217) Authorizes appropriations for administration of regulation of ocean dumping under the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act, not to exceed $5,300,000 for fiscal year 1976, and not to exceed $1,325,000 for the transition period from July 1, through September 30, 1976. Authorizes the appropriation for monitoring and research relating to ocean dumping under such Act of not to exceed $1,500,000 for the transition period. Authorizes necessary appropriations for the designation of and the regulation and enforcement of marine sanctuaries including the acquisition, development, and operation of sanctuaries, under such Act of not to exceed $6,200,000 for fiscal year 1976; and not to exceed $1,550,000 for the transition period.

titles.title: A bill to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1976 for the purpose of carrying out titles I and III of the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1972, as amended.

An Act to amend the Marine Protection, Research, and Sanctuaries Act of 1972 to authorize appropriations to carry out the provisions of such Act for fiscal year 1976 and for the transition period following such fiscal year, and for other purposes.
